Portal 2 is the best game ever made.
Not kidding.
The Game has a masterful story, making you feel involved, while spreading that story evenly through 3 unique chapters that you can leave any time. The emotions you feel along with this, and the fact along with this they made the best co-op mode in any game ever? this game deserves a play from you.

This review does not contain spoilers.

Puzzle-platformer game with unique mechanics. Cutscenes in the singleplayer campaign are great. Ending was unexpected, but there was foreshadowing.

Aside from the singleplayer campaign, there is also the co-op campaign and community test chambers. I recommend completing singleplayer, co-op, and then do community test chambers, in that order. If you don't have friends (like me), then you won't play the co-op, but I still feel that the game is worth $10 even if you don't play co-op.

Portal 2 has near-infinite content. I have played for 25 hours as of this review, and I've only played the singleplayer campaign and some community test chambers. If you're not aware, Portal 2 supports the Steam Workshop, meaning you can make your own test chambers and play ones that others have made.

Portal 2, at its core, is a puzzle game with teleportation mechanics. You can only place portals on flat, white surfaces (so you can place portals on white floors, walls, and ramps, but not a white pipe or anything black). This limitation makes for interesting puzzles. There are many test elements and synergies between them, and the test elements are introduced gradually in singleplayer.

I can't say much about co-op, but what I can say is this:
-You can play co-op online
-You can play co-op splitscreen
-Co-op takes place after the singleplayer campaign (or so I've heard)

It also has a quite active speedrunning community.

Community Test Chambers:
-You can make your own levels from within the game.
-You can play "Top Rated" test chambers. These are the top rated of (I think) all-time.
-You can play "Most Popular" test chambers. These are the most popular of the past week, ensuring that you get recent but good levels.
-You can play "Most recent" test chambers. I haven't played this setting much. This is where every test chamber starts out, but I assume that this setting contains both good and bad test chambers.

Negatives:
-Sometimes when I use the "Quick play" in the Community Test Chambers, it times out. This is not all of the time, but you can get around it until it fixes itself by subscribing to test chambers on the Steam workshop, whether you do it in Steam or the game itself.
-The subtitles miss words sometimes, but it's not a big deal. Most of the time the subtitles are accurate.

Summary:
Portal 2 is a great game with glitches that only speedrunners would find. I didn't find a single glitch in my playthrough. Whether you are interested for its singleplayer, co-op, community test chambers, or to make your own levels, this game is a must-buy even at its full price of $9.99. If you can get it on sale, that's even better!

Note: I have not played Portal 1.

Puzzling, but in a good way.

From what I've played (only the singleplayer), the game is an absolute joy to play with the controls and puzzles. And the amazingly witty and hilarious writing tie the game together. 
And the multiplayer is terrific (from the YouTubers I've seen play it.), even though I don't have anyone that wants to play it with.

I don't put put reviews often, especially to old games that everyone knows and loves already, but I finally finished it and damn. I am and mad at myself for not playing this gold. The tests are fun, it never gets boring, the story telling , writing and voice acting is Amazing! I genuinely got emotion when the game ended and I have no idea why. I can't wait to play the community maps and co-op. 

If just got your pc and looking to play the good old games, this game is on top of my list, try it, you won't regret it.

This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.
